Description: In a settlement agreement with the United States, Safeway, the nation's second largest grocery store chain, has agreed to pay a $600,000 civil penalty and implement a corporate-wide plan to significantly reduce its emissions of ozone-depleting substances from refrigeration equipment at 659 of its stores nationwide, estimated to cost approximately $4.1 million, announced the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and Department of Justice.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/united-states-reaches-settlement-safeway-reduce-emissions-ozone-depleting-substances

Description: Safeway, Inc., Wyoming, agreed to pay $56,994 for allegedly violating the Civil Monetary Penalties Law by submitting claims to Medicare Part D for the branded drug Protonix when it dispensed the authorized Protonix generic drug known as pantoprazole.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Info Source: https://oig.hhs.gov/fraud/enforcement/cmp/cmp-ae.asp

Description: The Department of Justice and Safeway (a division of Albertsons Companies, Inc.) reached a civil settlement of allegations the company failed to timely report controlled substances that were missing from pharmacies. Safeway agreed to pay the United States $3 million and implement a compliance agreement reached with the Drug Enforcement Administration to ensure such notification lapses do not happen again.
Info Source: https://www.dea.gov/divisions/sea/2017/sea071817.shtml

Description: Safeway agreed to pay $245,000 as part of the resolution of a lawsuit alleging that it violated state law by selling tobacco products to minors and failing to take proper steps to prevent such sales.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-settlement-safeway-curb-tobacco-sales-minors

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/us-epa-settles-supermarket-chain-vons-over-chemical-safety-violations

Company: New Albertsons, L.P., d/b/a Osco Pharmacy
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-nh/pr/two-pharmacy-chains-pay-civil-monetary-penalties-resolve-alleged-violations-controlled

Description: Safeway agreed to pay over $9 million in settlement of allegations by 43 California District Attorneys and two city attorneys that it violated state laws concerning the handling and disposal of hazardous waste produced by products sold and used in its stores, and incorrectly disposed of consumer records containing confidential medical information.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2015/jan/safeway_to_pay_987_million_#more

Description: Albertsons agreed to pay a total of $3.3 million to the District Attorneys in Riverside, Orange, San Bernadino, San Diego and Ventura as well as the Los Angeles City Attorney's Office in settlement of allegations it violated state hazardous waste law concerning handling, transporting and disposing of hazardous products sold and used by its stores around California.
Info Source: http://rivcoda.org/opencms/system/galleries/download/daReleases/NEWS_RELEASE_--_Albertsons_ordered_to_pay_$3_million_settlement_in_hazardous_waste_lawsuit.pdf

Description: Safeway agreed to pay $2.25 million in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys of Alameda, Marin, Fresno, Napa, Sacramento, Santa Cruz, Solano, Sonoma, and Ventura counties that it unlawfully charged consumers prices that were higher than its lowest advertised price, misrepresented the weight of Safeway-branded products, and made statements on in-store signage that conveyed the impression that certain produce was locally grown when in fact it had been sourced from outside California.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2014/mar/da_omalley_announces_225_mill_injunction#more

Description: Albertsons agreed to pay $2 million to the District Attorneys of Monterey, Napa and Solano counties as well as the City Attorney of San Diego to resolve allegations that it failed to subtract the weight of certain packaging when charging customers for deli products and bulk food items including coffee and candy.
Info Source: Albertson's Settles Case Involving Alleged Unfair Business Practices, US States News, May 31, 2006 (via Nexis).

Description: Albertson's was fined $30,000 by the district attorneys of Alameda and San Francisco counties for mislabeling wines.
Info Source: https://www.supermarketnews.com/archive/safeway-albertsons-fined-mislabeling
